list_definition.definition: a state of disorder or confusion; an untidy, dirty or unpleasant sight or muddle

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This room is in a terrible mess!
The spilt food made a mess on the carpet.

list_definition.definition: (with with) to meddle, or to have something to do with

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She’s always messing with the television set.

list_ex_of_english: What is the most reliable way out of the interpretational mess?
Negative views on performance make people shy away from the ideology that is suspected to lurk beneath the mess.
I will take hide and offal, leave no mess free of charge.
The kitchen and mess room are contained within a single elevated building.
You start looking at the legal materials, and as is usual, they are a mess.
With the application of ultraviolet light, the epoxy cures to its fully hardened state with no mixing or additional mess.
She would not sleep at night, waking up at all hours, playing and making a mess.
Or to put it the other way round, 'respect the classics, they should not be messed around with, attempts to interpret are out of order'.
